text:
Hi nice to meet you.
I am a Senior Software Engineer who specializes in React/Redux, Vue.js FE development and Node.js, Laravel, Ruby on Rails BE development.
can you please let me know any job opportunity for me to work full-time?
I am sure I could be an immediate, valuable asset for the success of your project, your team and your business.

Hi Roy,
Please checkout the Job channel it might help you.

No idea, but thank you for the SEO juice, we’ve worked hard on that site!

:stuck_out_tongue:

I’ll let the forms team know. Given the obscurity of the redirect and that it shouldn’t really affect any use-cases I can think of, I don’t know how soon they’ll do something about it.

Did you have a use-case where it made sense to link to that URL?

Our esteemed engineers say they’ll get this going to it’s correct redirect URL. Which I’m told should be <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ|this>.

:slightly_smiling_face: Happy April
I aint clicking on that — Dennis already sold me on it yesterday
And no — the only reason we found out about it was because a client did an audit of somekind and found it

Hi Team I am trying to get `access token`
I am making `post` request to <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token|this URL> with the below prams
• grant_type
• client_id
• client_secret
• redirect_uri
• code
I am getting 400 Bad Requests with the below message
Can anybody help me what I am doing wrong
```{
    "status": "BAD_GRANT_TYPE",
    "message": "missing or unknown grant type",
    "correlationId": "3a39e31b-2e24-4315-8fb2-27357238cd16"
}```
Check you are using form-data, it is not a JSON post

Thanks, <@UAX5LJ9K3> for helping me
 I am not sending anything in the  body of the  request so why I have need to set form-data
ok but where are you putting the params?
Let's say you're using Postman, this is the part you are probably missing:
Thanks, <@UAX5LJ9K3> I have found the issue actually I was missing `Content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=utf-8` in *Headers*
I was sending data in Params extreme left option in postman
This happens all the time... and the documentation is pretty confusing on all the oauth topic

question for HubSpot Video 2.0. I know you can grab the HubL snippet from the file manager. Can you use a normal text module in order for the tracking to still work? or do we still have to stick with the Richtext or Video module?
Does anyone want to share their <https://twitter.com/itsmaret/status/1509926628016766984|thoughts>?
